content.instruction: What is the Historical Context of What I See?

hotspots.hotspot: Harper's Weekly was a popular magazine. It was focused on exposing corrupt business practices, monopolies, and abuses of government power.
Andrew Carnegie of Carnegie Steel owned the plant at Homestead, Pennsylvania. The plant employed more than 3,000 union workers.
In the late 1800s, many labor unions were striking and organizing boycotts to demand better wages and working conditions.
In 1892, Carnegie ordered Henry Frick, the manager of the Homestead plant, to cut workers' wages. This set off a conflict with the plant's union workers.

hotspots.hotspot: Frick called in the Pinkertons, a private army employed by Pinkerton's Detective Agency and hired by business owners to break strikes and other union activities.
When the Pinkertons disembarked, fighting broke out.
After 14 hours, the Pinkertons surrendered and abandoned the barges.

This illustration shows the Pinkertons being removed from the scene after their surrender. It does not show the Pennsylvania National Guard protecting the Pinkerton strikebreakers and ending the strike.

content.instruction:
Title: I Have Here In My Hand --
Cartoonist: Herblock (Herb Block)
Published in: The Washington Post
Date: 1954

hotspots.hotspot:
Caricature

Caricature exaggerates features of a person or thing. The exaggerated features say something about the subject's appearance, character, beliefs, actions, or significance.

Symbolism

A symbol is an object that stands for something else. In political cartoons, a symbol is a recognizable object that represents something abstract or invisible, such as a dove representing world peace.

Irony

Irony is the use of words or actions that contradict what is really going on.

Metaphor

A metaphor relates two completely different objects to each other.

Stereotype

Stereotypes take a real or an imagined trait of one individual and make it true for the whole group to which the individual belongs. They are usually dangerous because they often lead to prejudice and can dehumanize individuals.
